00056  *

00060 #ifndef LMDES_H
00061 #define LMDES_H
00062 
00063 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00064 #include <config.h>
00065 #include <stdio.h>
00066 #include <library/dynamic_symbol.h>
00067 #include <library/set.h>
00068 
00069 /* For Lcode, casts void pointer for Mdes_Info */
00070 #define MDES_INFO(oper) ((Mdes_Info *)(oper->mdes_info))
00071 
00072 /* Operand/sync specifiers */
00073 #define                 MDES_PRED       0
00074 #define                 MDES_DEST       1
00075 #define                 MDES_SRC        2
00076 #define                 MDES_SYNC_IN    3
00077 #define                 MDES_SYNC_OUT   4
00078 
00079 /* Processor model, must be identical to hmdes.h declaration */
00080 #define                 MDES_SUPERSCALAR        0
00081 #define                 MDES_VLIW               1
00082 
00083 /* Mdes_Rused flags */
00084 #define MDES_OVERLAPPING_REQUEST        0x00000001
00085 
00086 typedef struct mdes_IO_set_st
00087 {
00088   int id;
00089   int external_id;
00090   char *name;
00091   int *mask;
00092 }
00093 Mdes_IO_Set;
00094

00100 }
00101 Mdes_IO_Item;

00104 {
00105   int id;
00106   char *name;
00107 }
00108 Mdes_Resource;
00109 
00110 typedef struct mdes_rmask_st
00111 {
00112   int *uncond;
00113   int *pred;
00114 }
00115 Mdes_Rmask;
00116 
00117 typedef struct mdes_Rused
00118 {
00119   int flags;                    /* Bit flags for Rused list entry */
00120   int start_usage;
00121   int end_usage;
00122   int num_options;
00123   Mdes_Rmask *option;
00124 }
00125 Mdes_Rused;
00126 
00127 typedef struct mdes_reslist_st
00128 {
00129   int id;
00130   char *name;
00131   int num_used;
00132   Mdes_Rused *used;
00133   int num_slot_options;         /* Number of slot options for this ResList */
00134   int *slot_options;            /* slot numbers, in mdes order (not sorted) */
00135   int num_RU_entries_required;
00136 }
00137 Mdes_ResList;

00145 }

00148 typedef struct mdes_alt_st
00149 {
00150   int id;
00151   char *asm_name;
00152   int alt_flags;
00153   struct mdes_operation_st *operation;
00154   Mdes_IO_Item *IO_item;
00155   Mdes_ResList *reslist;        /* NULL if .lmdes2 used */
00156   Mdes_Latency *latency;
00157   struct SM_Table *table;       /* NULL if .lmdes used */
00158 }
00159 Mdes_Alt;

00161 typedef struct Mdes_Stats
00162 {
00163   int num_oper_checks;
00164   int num_oper_checks_failed;
00165   int num_table_checks;
00166   int num_table_checks_failed;
00167   int num_option_checks;
00168   int num_option_checks_failed;
00169   int num_usage_checks;
00170   int num_usage_checks_failed;
00171   int num_slot_checks;
00172   int num_slot_checks_failed;
00173   INT_Symbol_Table *first_choice_dist;
00174   INT_Symbol_Table *num_choice_dist;
00175   INT_Symbol_Table *succeed_option_check_dist;
00176   INT_Symbol_Table *fail_option_check_dist;
00177   INT_Symbol_Table *succeed_usage_check_dist;
00178   INT_Symbol_Table *fail_usage_check_dist;
00179 }
00180 Mdes_Stats;
00181 
00182 typedef struct mdes_operation_st
00183 {
00184   int id;
00185   int opcode;
00186   char *external_name;
00187   int num_alts;
00188   Mdes_Alt *alt;
00189   int op_flags;
00190   int heuristic_alt;            /* Used for heuristics */
00191 
00192   /* 20030528 SZU
00193    * Added to keep track of port and syllable types, by hex mask value.
00194    * Used for scheduling and bundling.
00195    */
00196   unsigned int syll_mask;
00197   unsigned int port_mask;
00198   unsigned int num_slots;       /* Used for number of slots operation takes */
00199                                 /* Example: L type take 2 slots */
00200   int nop;                      /* 1 if has nop field, 0 if not */
00201 
00202   /* 20020805 SZU
00203    * Added to keep track of latency classes.
00204    * 20020823 SZU
00205    * Modified for a Set instead.
00206    */
00207   int num_lat_class;
00208   Set lat_class;
00209 
00210   /* For mdes statistics */
00211   Mdes_Stats can_sched_prepass;
00212   Mdes_Stats sched_prepass;
00213   Mdes_Stats can_sched_postpass;
00214   Mdes_Stats sched_postpass;
00215 }
00216 Mdes_Operation;
00217 
00218 typedef struct mdes_st
00219 {
00220   char *file_name;
00221   int processor_model;          /* MDES_SUPERSCALAR, MDES_VLIW */
00222   int number[5];                /* Number of each operand/sync type */
00223   int offset[5];                /* Offset for each operand/sync type */
00224   char *name[5];                /* Name of each operand/sync type */
00225   int operand_count;
00226   int latency_count;
00227   int num_slots;
00228   int max_slot;
00229   int IOmask_width;
00230   int num_reg_files;
00231   int max_IO_set_id;
00232   int null_external_id;
00233   Mdes_IO_Set **IO_set_table;   /* Indexed by external id */
00234   int num_IO_sets;
00235   Mdes_IO_Set *IO_set;
00236   int num_IO_items;
00237   Mdes_IO_Item *IO_item;
00238   int num_resources;
00239   Mdes_Resource *resource;
00240   int num_reslists;
00241   int Rmask_width;
00242   Mdes_ResList *reslist;
00243   int num_latencies;
00244   Mdes_Latency *latency;
00245   int num_operations;
00246   Mdes_Operation *operation;
00247   int max_opcode;
00248   Mdes_Operation **op_table;    /* Indexed by opcode */
00249   Mdes_IO_Set **operand_type_buf;       /* Used by Build_Mdes_Info */
00250   int *index_type;              /* For reverse mapping operand index */
00251   int *index_number;            /* For reverse mapping operand index */
00252 
00253   /* Start converting routines over to version2 data structures */
00254   struct Mdes2 *mdes2;
00255 
00256   /* New parameter for version2 mdes.  If set, the scheduler only
00257    * needs to only check the resource constraints for the first alternative
00258    * to match format and dependence requirements, otherwise (per original
00259    * specification) all alternatives need to be checked (until a match
00260    * is found or there are no more alternatives).  Makes describing
00261    * the SuperSPARC's cascadable operations more efficient.
00262    */
00263   int check_resources_for_only_one_alt;
00264 }
00265 Mdes;
00266 
00267 typedef struct mdes_compatable_alt_st
00268 {
00269   Mdes_Alt *alt;
00270   struct mdes_compatable_alt_st *next;
00271 }
00272 Mdes_Compatable_Alt;
00273 
00274 typedef struct Mdes_Info
00275 {
00276   int opcode;                   /* For debugging */
00277   int num_compatable_alts;
00278   Mdes_Compatable_Alt *compatable_alts; /* Linked list */
00279 }
00280 Mdes_Info;
